document_data.name: Gunggari Ulmarra
document_data.mainbody: '''Gunggari Ulmarra''' was a [[tattoo]]ed soldier from the southern continent of [[Osse]] who around {{yearlink|1371}} found company with the warrior priest, [[Marrec]] of [[Lurue]]. He joined him in his quest to restore his connection with [[Lurue]] in {{yearlink|1373}}.{{cite book/Lady of Poison|9-11|2}}
document_data.Description: He was clad in little, save thick-soled leather shoes and a [[breechcloth]], whilst sporting several tattoos on his body.{{cite book/Lady of Poison|44|5}}
document_data.Abilities:
Gunggari used his dizheri as a deadly weapon.{{cite book/Lady of Poison|21|4}} He was quite alert,{{cite book/Lady of Poison|66|8}} and his stealth was on par with [[Elowen]]'s.{{cite book/Lady of Poison|76|9}}

He could also produce some mystical effects out of his dizheri, such as a soundwave that pushed people off their feet; it was strong enough to afflict even [[demon]] lords such as [[Eschar]].{{cite book/Lady of Poison|196-197|19}}
document_data.Personality:
Gunggari enjoyed traveling. He spoke his mind without great need for deceit.{{cite book/Lady of Poison|45|5}} He was nothing if not practical.{{cite book/Lady of Poison|179|18}}

Gunggari hated [[vampires]] more than anything else.{{cite book/Lady of Poison|255|27}} He showed his respect for the divine through his reserve.{{cite book/Lady of Poison|302|31}} He became more talkative and poised after meeting with the restored [[Araluen]].{{cite book/Lady of Poison|304|305}}
document_data.Possessions: His sole possession of value was his [[dizheri]], which served as a walking stick, a musical instrument, and as a [[club]]-like weapon. It was covered in colorful designs.{{cite book/Lady of Poison|128-129|13}}
document_data.Relationships: Gunggari had joined [[Marrec]] in his travels over two years before {{yearlink|1373}},{{cite book/Lady of Poison|111|12}} who had rescued him from the brink of death more than once.{{cite book/Lady of Poison|194|19}} He made fast friends with [[Elowen]]{{cite book/Lady of Poison|43|5}} whom he treated to many of his stories,{{cite book/Lady of Poison|67-68|8}} though the wisdom of his homeland was far too gruff for her palate.{{cite book/Lady of Poison|89|10}}
document_data.History:
Before he began traveling with Marrec in {{yearlink|1371}}, Gunggari Ulmarra was a [[tattooed soldier]] in [[Osse]]. He crossed the [[Great Sea]], arriving at [[Faer√ªn]],{{cite book/Lady of Poison|32|4}} He accompanied Marrec on his trip to [[Fullpoint]]; both travelers crossed the [[Sea of Fallen Stars]]{{cite book/Lady of Poison|42|5}}

Throughout Marrec's mission to restore his contact with his goddess, [[Lurue]],{{cite book/Lady of Poison|253|27}} tracking,{{cite book/Lady of Poison|160|16}} fighting,{{cite book/Lady of Poison|13-17|2}} and in rare occassions, with actual magic.{{cite book/The Grand History of the Realms|154}}
